clauses.title: DUTIES
clauses.text: 1. DUTIES.
clauses.reasoning: The title 'DUTIES' suggests obligations or tasks, but the text provided is incomplete ('# Limit to avoid token overflow'). Without substantive language, the closest standard category is scope_of_work as it pertains to duties or deliverables, but the clause content is missing.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT agrees to exercise special skill to accomplish the following results in a manner
clauses.text:
A. CONSULTANT agrees to exercise special skill to accomplish the following results in a manner 
reasonably satisfactory to COMMISSION: ______________________________, as specified in Exhibit 
A: Scope of Services, which by this reference is incorporated herein.
key_obligations: Consultant must exercise special skill to accomplish specified results
Performance to be done in a manner reasonably satisfactory to Commission
Refer to Exhibit A for the exact Scope of Services
red_flags: Subjective standard of 'reasonably satisfactory' may create ambiguity in performance expectations
Lack of objective acceptance criteria or remedies for dissatisfaction
clauses.reasoning: The clause references performing services with a defined scope (Exhibit A: Scope of Services) and requires satisfactory performance, focusing on the work to be done rather than rights or protections.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT shall provide the personnel listed below to perform the above-specified services, which
clauses.text:
B. CONSULTANT shall provide the personnel listed below to perform the above-specified services, which 
persons are hereby designated as key personnel under this Agreement. 
 
Name 
 
 
Firm 
 
 
 
Function 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Principal in Charge 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Project Manager
key_obligations: CONSULTANT shall provide personnel listed to perform the services
Personnel designated as key personnel under the Agreement
red_flags: No explicit qualifications, exclusivity, or replacement terms for key personnel
Vague on number, names, or acceptance criteria for personnel
Potential risk if key personnel fail to perform or are unavailable
clauses.reasoning: This clause concerns personnel assignment and designation as key personnel. It does not neatly fit standard categories like confidentiality, indemnification, or payment. It aligns closest to scope_of_work or definitions but lacks concrete deliverables or terms. Therefore classified as 'other'.

clauses.title: No person named in paragraph B of this Section, or his or her successor, shall be removed or replaced by
clauses.text:
C. No person named in paragraph B of this Section, or his or her successor, shall be removed or replaced by 
CONSULTANT, nor shall his or her agreed-upon function hereunder be changed, without the prior 
written consent of COMMISSION. Such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
key_obligations: No person named in paragraph B or their successor may be removed or replaced by the CONSULTANT without prior written consent of COMMISSION.
Consent shall not be unreasonably withheld.
red_flags: Possible ambiguity about who can consent and remedies if consent is withheld or deemed unreasonable
Potential rigidity affecting personnel changes and project continuity
clauses.reasoning: The clause restricts removal or replacement of named persons and requires prior written consent of COMMISSION, indicating control over personnel assignment and potential transfer of rights/roles. It resembles limits on substitution or assignment of personnel rather than a traditional IP or contractual transfer, but fits closest to assignment/obligation control over personnel.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT’S PROGRESS REPORTS AND/OR MEETINGS
clauses.text:
D. CONSULTANT’S PROGRESS REPORTS AND/OR MEETINGS 
1) The CONSULTANT shall submit written progress reports with each invoice. The report should be 
sufficiently detailed for the Contract Manager to determine if the CONSULTANT is performing to 
expectations or is on schedule; to provide communication of interim findings; and to sufficiently 
address any difficulties or special problems encountered, so remedies can be developed. 
2) The CONSULTANT’s Project Manager shall meet with the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager, as 
needed, to discuss progress on the contract.
key_obligations: Consultant must submit written progress reports with each invoice detailing performance, schedule, interim findings, difficulties, and remedies.
Consultant Project Manager must meet with the Commission’s Contract Manager as needed to discuss progress.
red_flags: No explicit cure or consequence for failing to meet progress milestones.
Ambiguity in what constitutes 'sufficiently detailed' or 'on schedule' may lead to subjective assessments.
clauses.reasoning: The clause governs required progress reporting and meetings related to contract performance, implying monitoring of deliverables and schedule. It fits under scope_of_work (services/deliverables) with performance monitoring language.

clauses.title: COMPENSATION
clauses.text:
2. COMPENSATION. 
In consideration for CONSULTANT accomplishing said result, COMMISSION agrees to pay 
CONSULTANT as follows:
key_obligations: COMMISION agrees to pay CONSULTANT for accomplished results (pending detail on amounts, timing, and methods).
red_flags: Missing payment amounts, schedule, invoicing terms, and payment mechanics; potential ambiguity in compensation structure.
clauses.reasoning: The heading and opening text indicate a compensation/payments obligation, specifying payment in exchange for services. The clause is incomplete, but the category aligns with compensation/payment terms.

clauses.title: Total payment is not to exceed $_____for time and materials at the rates and conditions set forth in
clauses.text:
A. Total payment is not to exceed $_____for time and materials at the rates and conditions set forth in 
Exhibit B: Fee Schedule, which by this reference is incorporated herein.
key_obligations: Total payment shall not exceed the stated cap ($_____) for time and materials.
Rates and conditions apply as specified in Exhibit B: Fee Schedule.
red_flags: Cap amount blank (requires filling in), creating ambiguity or risk of dispute.
Reliance on Exhibit B for rates may require cross-document alignment; potential for inconsistency if Exhibit B changes.
clauses.reasoning: The clause sets a monetary payment cap and references a fee schedule, indicating a financial obligation framework. It does not fit other standard categories as a cap on payment with reference to exhibit.

clauses.title: In no event, will the CONSULTANT be reimbursed for overhead costs at a rate that exceeds the
clauses.text:
B. In no event, will the CONSULTANT be reimbursed for overhead costs at a rate that exceeds the 
overhead rate set forth in the Fee Schedule.
key_obligations: Consultant will not be reimbursed for overhead costs above the overhead rate set forth in the Fee Schedule.
red_flags: Potential ambiguity if Fee Schedule is altered unilaterally
Lack of clarity on what constitutes 'overhead' and whether exceptions exist
clauses.reasoning: The clause concerns reimbursement of overhead costs and fees, which relates to compensation/payments under the contract. It does not fit a more specific category like indemnification or expense reimbursement explicitly, so 'payment' is the closest standard category.

clauses.title: Transportation and subsistence costs shall not exceed the rates authorized to employees under current
clauses.text:
C. Transportation and subsistence costs shall not exceed the rates authorized to employees under current 
U.S. General Service Administration rules.
clauses.clause_type: costs (not in standard list; treat as 'other')
key_obligations: Reimbursable transportation and subsistence costs must not exceed GSA-authorized rates for current employees.
red_flags: Ambiguity about which party is eligible for reimbursement
Reference to 'current' rates without specifying effective date or scope
clauses.reasoning: The clause governs expense reimbursement limits for transportation and subsistence costs aligned to GSA rates. It does not map neatly to a standard category; closest proxy is 'payment' or 'expense reimbursement' which is not in the provided list, so labeled as 'other'.

clauses.title: Reimbursable expenses will be billed by CONSULTANT and processed for payment upon approval of
clauses.text:
D. Reimbursable expenses will be billed by CONSULTANT and processed for payment upon approval of 
the Contract Manager.
key_obligations: Consultant will bill reimbursable expenses.
Contract Manager must approve expenses before payment.
red_flags: No rate or cap for expenses
No payment timeline
No dispute resolution if approval delayed
clauses.reasoning: The clause concerns billing and payment processing for reimbursable expenses, which fits under payment. It references approval by a Contract Manager but lacks detail on rates, timelines, or caps.

clauses.title: Progress payments will be made no less than monthly in arrears based on satisfactory services provided
clauses.text:
E. Progress payments will be made no less than monthly in arrears based on satisfactory services provided 
and actual allowable incurred costs. A pro rata portion of the CONSULTANT’s fixed fee, if applicable, 
will be included in the monthly progress payments. If CONSULTANT fails to submit the required

Page 2 
deliverable items according to the schedule set forth in the Scope of Services, the COMMISSION may 
delay payment and/or terminate this Agreement in accordance with the provisions of Section 4 of this 
Agreement.
key_obligations: Client shall make progress payments no less than monthly in arrears.
Payments based on satisfactory services provided and actual allowable incurred costs.
Include a pro rata portion of the CONSULTANT’s fixed fee in each monthly payment (if applicable).
Consultant must submit the required deliverable items according to the Scope of Services schedule.
Commission may delay payment or terminate the agreement if deliverables are not submitted as scheduled.
red_flags: No express payment deadline or due date beyond 'monthly in arrears' (potential ambiguity).
Possible termination right tied to payment delays (dependent on Section 4 not provided).
No explicit interest or late fees for delayed payments.
clauses.reasoning: The clause discusses progress payments, timing (monthly in arrears), conditions (satisfactory services, incurred costs), and consequences (delay payment or termination for delinquency). It aligns with a general payment/compensation framework.

clauses.title: No payment will be made prior to approval of any work, nor for any work performed prior to approval
clauses.text:
F. No payment will be made prior to approval of any work, nor for any work performed prior to approval 
of this Agreement.
key_obligations: No payment will be made before approval of any work.
No payment will be made for work performed prior to approval of the Agreement.
red_flags: No detail on criteria for approval
No remedy or escalation if approval delays occur
Potential ambiguity about what constitutes 'approval' and 'work'
clauses.reasoning: The clause discusses payment timing and conditions related to approval of work, which falls under payment-related provisions.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT shall not exceed milestone cost estimates as shown in Exhibit B, except with the prior
clauses.text:
G. CONSULTANT shall not exceed milestone cost estimates as shown in Exhibit B, except with the prior 
written approval of the Contract Manager.
key_obligations: Consultant shall not exceed milestone cost estimates in Exhibit B
Any exception requires prior written approval of the Contract Manager
red_flags: Approval requirement introduces potential project delay if approvals are not obtained
No explicit consequences or remedies if cost overrun occurs beyond approval process
clauses.reasoning: The clause governs cost discipline and approval for exceeding cost estimates, but does not map exactly to a standard category. Closest fit is related to payment/cost control; not a standard category list. If forced to choose, 'payment' is the nearest, though not a perfect match.

clauses.title: The CONSULTANT will be reimbursed after receipt by the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager of
clauses.text:
H. The CONSULTANT will be reimbursed after receipt by the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager of 
itemized invoices. Invoices shall be submitted no later than 45calendar days after the performance of 
work for which the CONSULTANT is billing. Invoices shall be mailed to the COMMISSION’s 
Contract Manager at the following address: 
SCCRTC, 1523 Pacific Ave, Santa Cruz, CA, 95060 
 
The invoices must include the following information: 
1. 
Labor (staff name, hours charged, hourly billing rate, current charges and cumulative 
charges) performed during the billing period by task; 
2. 
Itemized expenses incurred during the billing period; 
3. 
Total invoice/payment requested; 
4. 
Total amount previously paid under this Agreement;
key_obligations: Consultant submits itemized invoices within 45 calendar days after performance
Invoices are mailed to the specified Contract Manager address
Invoices must include labor details, itemized expenses, total amount due, and total previously paid
clauses.reasoning: Clause governs reimbursement of consultant expenses and invoicing procedure, including timing, submission, and required invoice details.

clauses.title: Report of expenditures by CONSULTANT and subconsultants for each task and subtask
clauses.text:
5. 
Report of expenditures by CONSULTANT and subconsultants for each task and subtask 
or milestone and estimated percentage completion by such divisions of work; 
6. 
Written progress reports, in a format to be mutually agreed upon, that is sufficiently 
detailed for the Contract Manager to determine if the CONSULTANT is performing to 
expectations and is on schedule; provides communication of interim findings; addresses 
any difficulties or special problems encountered, so remedies can be developed; and other 
information as requested by COMMISSION. 
7. 
CONSULTANT's final invoice must be submitted within 60-calendar days after 
acceptance of the CONSULTANT’s work by the Contract Manager.
key_obligations: Consultant and subconsultants must report expenditures for each task/subtask or milestone.
Provide estimated percentage completion by divisions of work.
Submit written progress reports in a mutually agreed format with sufficient detail for Contract Manager.
Report interim findings and communicate difficulties or problems to enable remedies.
Consultant to submit final invoice within 60 calendar days after acceptance by Contract Manager.
red_flags: Final invoice deadline could create cash-flow risk if acceptance is delayed, potential for disputes over timing.
clauses.reasoning: The clause describes reporting obligations (expenditures, progress reports, final invoice timing). It does not map to a standard category exactly, but most closely aligns with 'notice' or 'audit_rights' / 'payment' given reporting and invoicing requirements. Since 'reporting' is not a listed category, I label as 'other'.

clauses.title: For personnel subject to prevailing wage rates as described in the California Labor Code, all salary
clauses.text:
I. For personnel subject to prevailing wage rates as described in the California Labor Code, all salary 
increases, which are the direct result of changes in the prevailing wage rates are reimbursable. 
 
3. 
TERM. This Agreement shall take effect on (DATE); contingent upon prior approval by the 
COMMISSION governing board, and the CONSULTANT shall commence work after notification to 
proceed by the COMMISSION’S Contract Manager. The Agreement shall end on (DATE), unless earlier 
terminated or extended by contract amendment. The CONSULTANT is advised that this Agreement is not 
binding and enforceable until it is fully executed and approved by the COMMISSION's board.
key_obligations: Reimburse salary increases that result directly from changes in prevailing wage rates for personnel subject to California Labor Code.
Ensure reimbursement aligns with prevailing wage adjustments.
red_flags: Ambiguity about methodology/timing of reimbursement
No explicit cap or dispute mechanism for reimbursements
Statement that agreement is not binding until full execution may affect enforceability
clauses.reasoning: The clause discusses salary increases and reimbursement related to prevailing wage rates, which relates to compensation/payments. It also includes a term/termination section, but primary focus is on payment/reimbursement terms.

clauses.title: EARLY TERMINATION
clauses.text:
4. 
EARLY TERMINATION.
clauses.reasoning: Only the title 'EARLY TERMINATION' is provided with minimal text; no substantive language to classify beyond termination concepts. Preference is to map to termination category when content is insufficient.

clauses.title: COMMISSION may terminate this Agreement for its convenience any time, in whole or part, by giving
clauses.text:
A. COMMISSION may terminate this Agreement for its convenience any time, in whole or part, by giving 
CONSULTANT thirty-day (30-day) written notice thereof. Within thirty days of the COMMISSION's 
receipt of CONSULTANT's final billing, COMMISSION shall pay CONSULTANT its allowable costs 
incurred to date of termination and those allowable costs determined by COMMISSION to be 
reasonably necessary to effect such termination. Thereafter, CONSULTANT shall have no further 
claims against COMMISSION under this Agreement.
key_obligations: COMMISSION may terminate the Agreement for its convenience with 30 days written notice.
COMMISSION shall pay CONSULTANT its allowable costs incurred to date of termination.
COMMISSION shall pay those allowable costs determined by COMMISSION to be reasonably necessary to effect termination.
CONSULTANT shall have no further claims against COMMISSION under the Agreement after termination.
red_flags: Termination for convenience by COMMISSION may lead to abrupt project cessation with limited remedies for CONSULTANT beyond incurred costs.
Reliance on 'allowable costs' and 'reasonably necessary' costs may create ambiguity or disputes over what constitutes payable amounts.
clauses.reasoning: The clause grants termination for convenience by one party (COMMISSION) and sets notice and payment of incurred costs, which aligns with termination rights and related procedures. It does not fit strictly into other categories like indemnification or data protection.

clauses.title: COMMISSION may terminate this Agreement for CONSULTANT's default if a federal or state
clauses.text:
B. COMMISSION may terminate this Agreement for CONSULTANT's default if a federal or state 
proceeding for the relief of debtors is undertaken by or against CONSULTANT, or CONSULTANT's

Page 3 
principal, or if CONSULTANT or CONSULTANT's principal makes an assignment for the benefit of 
creditors, or if CONSULTANT breaches any term(s) or violates any provision(s) of this Agreement and 
does not cure such breach or violation within ten (10) days after written notice thereof by 
COMMISSION. CONSULTANT shall be liable for any and all reasonable costs incurred by 
COMMISSION as a result of such default, including but not limited to reprocurement costs of the same 
or similar services defaulted by CONSULTANT under this Agreement.
key_obligations: Commission may terminate the agreement for CONSULTANT's default
CONSULTANT has a 10-day cure period after written notice for breaches or violations
red_flags: Termination for insolvency/assignment for benefit of creditors without stated limitations
No detail on scope of breaches, materiality, or potential cure extension
Reprocurement costs potentially uncapped beyond 'reasonable costs'
clauses.reasoning: The clause describes termination rights by Commission for CONSULTANT's default, including breach, insolvency actions, and defaults with a cure period.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT may terminate this Agreement by giving the COMMISSION at least one hundred and
clauses.text:
C. CONSULTANT may terminate this Agreement by giving the COMMISSION at least one hundred and 
twenty (120) days advance written notice. CONSULTANT shall be liable for any and all reasonable 
costs incurred by COMMISSION as a result of such default, including but not limited to reprocurement 
costs of the same or similar services defaulted or not provided by CONSULTANT under this 
Agreement. 
 
5. INDEMNIFICATION FOR DAMAGES, TAXES AND CONTRIBUTIONS. 
CONSULTANT shall exonerate, indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the COMMISSION (which for the 
purpose of this Agreement shall include, without limitation, its officers, agents, employees and volunteers) 
from and against:
key_obligations: CONSULTANT may terminate with at least 120 days advance written notice.
CONSULTANT shall be liable for reasonable costs incurred by COMMISSION as a result of CONSULTANT's default (e.g., reprocurement costs).
COMMISION is entitled to reimbursement of specified costs following termination.
red_flags: Relatively long notice period may create continuity risk for COMMISSION.
Unclear definition of 'default' and how costs are calculated; potential ambiguity in 'reasonable costs' and scope of reprocurement.
clauses.reasoning: The clause primarily grants CONSULTANT the right to terminate the agreement on 120 days' advance notice and discusses liability for costs resulting from such default, which centers on termination rights and consequences.

clauses.title: Any and all claims, demands, losses, damages, defense costs, or liability of any kind or nature which
clauses.text:
A. Any and all claims, demands, losses, damages, defense costs, or liability of any kind or nature which 
COMMISSION may sustain or incur or which may be imposed upon it for injury to or death of persons, 
or damage to property which arise out of, pertain to, or relate to CONSULTANT’S negligence, 
recklessness, or willful misconduct under the terms of this Agreement. Such indemnification includes 
any damage to the person(s), or property(ies) of CONSULTANT and third persons.
key_obligations: COMMISSION must indemnify CONSULTANT for claims arising from CONSULTANT’s negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct
Indemnity covers injury to persons, property damage, and defense costs
Indemnity extends to third-party damages
red_flags: Broad, uncapped indemnity for own misconduct with no carve-outs
No explicit carve-outs for gross negligence or intentional misconduct by CONSULTANT (reciprocity unclear)
Ambiguity on who bears defense costs beyond defined scope
clauses.reasoning: The clause requires one party (COMMISSION) to indemnify the other for claims arising from CONSULTANT’s negligence, recklessness, or willful misconduct, including third-party damages.

clauses.title: Any and all Federal, State and Local taxes, charges, fees, or contributions required to be paid with
clauses.text:
B. Any and all Federal, State and Local taxes, charges, fees, or contributions required to be paid with 
respect to CONSULTANT and CONSULTANT’S officers, employees and agents engaged in the 
performance of this Agreement (including, without limitation, unemployment insurance, social security 
and payroll tax withholding). 
 
6. INSURANCE. CONSULTANT, at its sole cost and expense, for the full term of this Agreement, and any 
extensions thereof, shall obtain and maintain at minimum compliance with all of the following insurance 
coverage(s) and requirements. Such insurance coverage shall be primary coverage as respects 
COMMISSION and any insurance or self-insurance maintained by COMMISSION shall be excess of 
CONSULTANT’S insurance coverage and shall not contribute to it. 
 
If CONSULTANT utilizes one or more subconsultants in the performance of this Agreement, 
CONSULTANT shall obtain and maintain Independent CONSULTANT’s Insurance as to each subconsultant 
or otherwise provide evidence of insurance coverage from each subconsultant equivalent to that required of 
CONSULTANT in this Agreement.
key_obligations: Consultant must obtain and maintain specified insurance coverage for the full term and any extensions.
Coverage must be primary; Commission's insurance is excess and not contributory.
If subconsultants are used, Consultant must obtain Independent Consultant insurance for each subconsultant or provide equivalent coverage evidence.
red_flags: No specified minimum coverage limits included in the excerpt (may be defined elsewhere).
Ambiguity about which specific policies are required (e.g., general liability, professional liability, workers' comp).
Potential gap if subconsultants’ coverage is not clearly defined or certified.
clauses.reasoning: The text mandates insurance coverage, primary liability, and subconsultant insurance requirements, fitting under insurance provisions of a contract.

clauses.title: Types of Insurance and Minimum Limits
clauses.text:
A. Types of Insurance and Minimum Limits 
 
1) Workers’ Compensation in the minimum statutorily required coverage amounts. This insurance 
coverage shall not be required if the CONSULTANT has no employees and certifies to this fact by 
initialing here . 
 
2) Automobile Liability Insurance for each of CONSULTANT’S vehicles used in the performance of 
this Agreement, including owned, non-owned (e.g. owned by CONSULTANT’S employees), leased 
or hired vehicles, in the minimum amount of $1,000,000 combined single limit per occurrence for 
bodily injury and property damage. This insurance coverage shall not be required if vehicle use by 
the CONSULTANT is not a material part of performance of this Agreement and CONSULTANT and 
COMMISSION both certify to this fact by initialing here / .

Page 4 
3) Comprehensive or Commercial General Liability Insurance coverage in the minimum amount of one 
million dollars ($1,000,000) combined single limit (CSL), including coverage for: (a) bodily injury, 
(b) personal injury, (c) broad form property damage, (d) contractual liability, and (e) cross-liability. 
 
4) Professional Liability Insurance in the minimum amount of one million dollars ($1,000,000) 
combined single limit, if, and only if, this Subparagraph is initialed by CONSULTANT and 
COMMISSION __ / .
key_obligations: Consultant must maintain specified insurance coverages at stated limits (workers’ comp, auto liability, general liability, professional liability).
Certification by CONSULTANT (and Commission) to waive required coverages where applicable.
Compliance with minimum coverage amounts for each insurance type.
red_flags: Carve-outs based on certification may create gaps in coverage if misused.
Reliance on self-certification could affect enforceability if not supported by insurer certificates.
No explicit requirement for notice of policy termination, cancellation, or insurer financial strength.
clauses.reasoning: The clause sets mandatory insurance types and minimum limits (workers' compensation, automobile liability, general liability, professional liability) as conditions of performance, with carve-outs based on certification. This fits the 'insurance' category.

clauses.title: Other Insurance Provisions
clauses.text:
B. Other Insurance Provisions 
1) If any insurance coverage required in this Agreement is provided on a “Claims Made” rather than 
“Occurrence” form, CONSULTANT agrees to maintain the required coverage for a period of three 
(3) years after the expiration of this Agreement (hereinafter “post agreement coverage”) and any 
extensions thereof. CONSULTANT may maintain the required post agreement coverage by renewal 
or purchase of prior acts or tail coverage. This provision is contingent upon post agreement coverage 
being both available and reasonably affordable in relation to the coverage provided during the term of 
this Agreement. For purposes of interpreting this requirement, a cost not exceeding 100% of the last 
annual policy premium during the term of this Agreement in order to purchase prior acts or tail 
coverage for post agreement coverage shall be deemed to be reasonable. The COMMISSION will not 
be responsible for any premiums or assessments on the policy. 
 
2) All required Automobile and Comprehensive or Commercial General Liability Insurance shall be 
endorsed to contain the following clause: 
 
“Santa Cruz County Regional Transportation Commission, its officials, employees, agents and 
volunteers are added as an additional insured as respects the operations and activities of, or on behalf 
of, the named insured performed under Agreement with the Commission.” 
 
3) All required insurance policies shall be endorsed to contain the following clause: 
“This insurance shall not be canceled until after thirty (30) days prior written notice has been given 
to: 
 
 
Santa Cruz County Regional Transportation Commission 
 
 
 
Attn: Yesenia Parra 
 
 
 
1523 Pacific Avenue 
Santa Cruz, CA 95060 
 
4) CONSULTANT agrees to provide its insurance broker(s) with a full copy of these insurance 
provisions and provide COMMISSION on or before the effective date of this Agreement with 
Certificates of Insurance for all required coverages. All Certificates of Insurance shall be delivered or 
sent to: 
 
 
 
Santa Cruz County Regional Transportation Commission 
 
 
 
Attn: Yesenia Parra 
 
 
 
1523 Pacific Avenue 
 
 
 
Santa Cruz, CA 95060 
 
 
 
5) The CONSULTANT agrees that the insurance herein provided for, shall be in effect at all times 
during the term of this contract. In the event said insurance coverage expires at any time or times 
during the term of this contract, the CONSULTANT agrees to provide at least thirty (30) days prior 
notice to said expiration date; and a new Certificate of Insurance evidencing insurance coverage as 
provided for herein, for not less than either the remainder of the term of the contract, or for a period 
of not less than one (1) year. New Certificates of Insurance are subject to the approval of the 
COMMISSION. In the event the CONSULTANT fails to keep in effect at all times insurance

Page 5 
coverage as herein provided, the COMMISSION may, in addition to any other remedies it may have, 
terminate this Agreement upon occurrence of such event. 
 
6) If any insurance policy of CONSULTANT required by this document includes language 
conditioning the insurer’s legal obligation to defend or indemnify COMMISSION on the 
performance of any act(s) by the named insured, then said insurance policy, by endorsement, 
shall also name the COMMISSION as a named insured. Notwithstanding the foregoing, both 
the CONSULTANT and its insurers agree that by naming the COMMISSION as a named 
insured, the COMMISSION may at its sole direction, but is not obligated to, perform any act 
required by the named insured under said insurance policies. 
 
7) CONSULTANT shall do all things required to be performed by it pursuant to its insurance policies 
including but not limited to paying within five (5) work days, all deductibles and self-insured 
retentions (SIR) required to be paid under any insurance policy that may provide defense or 
indemnity coverage to COMMISSION or any additional insured. 
 
8) CONSULTANT shall cause the foregoing provisions to be inserted in all subcontracts for any work 
covered under this Agreement by a subconsultant compensated more than $50,000 and employing 
more than fifteen (15) employees, provided that the foregoing provisions shall not apply to contracts 
or subcontracts for standard commercial supplies or raw materials. 
 
7. FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LAWS. CONSULTANT warrants that in the performance of this 
Agreement, it shall exercise usual and customary professional care in its efforts to comply with all applicable 
federal, state and local laws, statutes and ordinances and all lawful orders, rules and regulations promulgated 
thereunder. In the event of a conflict between the laws and lawful regulations of any government entities 
having jurisdiction over the project, the CONSULTANT shall notify COMMISSION of the nature and 
impact of such conflict. The COMMISSION agrees to cooperate and work with the CONSULTANT in an 
effort to resolve any conflict. 
 
8. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY. During and in relation to the performance of this Agreement, 
CONSULTANT agrees to the following: 
 
The CONSULTANT shall not discriminate or permit discrimination against any employee or applicant for 
employment in any manner prohibited by Federal, State and local laws, including but not limited to race, 
color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital 
status, sexual orientation, age (over 18), veteran status, pregnancy, or any other non-merit factor unrelated to 
job duties. 
 
Such action shall include, but not be limited to, the following: recruitment; advertising, layoff or termination; 
rates of pay or other forms of compensation; and selection for training (including apprenticeship), 
employment, upgrading, demotion, or transfer. The CONSULTANT agrees to post in conspicuous places, 
available to employees and applicants for employment, notice setting forth the provisions of this non-
discrimination clause. 
 
CONSULTANT shall comply fully with all federal, State and local laws and regulations which prohibit 
discrimination. The CONSULTANT’s signature affixed herein, and dated, shall constitute a certification 
under penalty of perjury under the laws of the State of California that the CONSULTANT has, unless 
exempt, complied with, the nondiscrimination program requirements of Government Code Section 12990 and 
Title 2, California Administrative Code, Section 8103.

Page 6 
In the event of CONSULTANT’S non-compliance with the non-discrimination clauses of this Agreement or 
with any of the said rules, regulations or orders the COMMISSION may cancel, terminate or suspend the 
Agreement in whole or in part. CONSULTANT may also be declared ineligible for further agreements with 
the COMMISSION. 
 
9. HARASSMENT. The COMMISSION maintains a strict policy prohibiting unlawful harassment, including 
sexual harassment, in any form, including verbal, physical and visual harassment by any employee, 
supervisor, manager, officer or Board member, or agent of the employer. Vendors, CONSULTANTs, and 
consultants shall not engage in conduct that has an effect of unreasonably interfering with a COMMISSION 
employee's work performance or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment. 
 
10. LICENSES. If a license of any kind is required of CONSULTANT, its employees, agents, or sub 
CONSULTANTs by Federal or State law, CONSULTANT warrants that such license has been obtained, is 
valid and in good standing, that CONSULTANT shall keep it in effect at all times during the terms of this 
Agreement, and that any applicable bond has been posted in accordance with all applicable laws and 
regulations. 
 
11. INDEPENDENT CONSULTANT STATUS. CONSULTANT and COMMISSION have reviewed and 
considered the principal test and secondary factors herein and agree that CONSULTANT is an independent 
CONSULTANT and not an employee of COMMISSION. CONSULTANT is responsible for all insurance 
(workers compensation, unemployment, etc.) and all payroll related taxes. CONSULTANT is not entitled to 
any employee benefits. COMMISSION agrees that CONSULTANT shall have the right to control the 
manner and means of accomplishing the result contracted for herein. 
 
 
PRINCIPAL TEST: The CONSULTANT rather than COMMISSION has the right to control the manner and 
means of accomplishing the result contracted for. 
 
SECONDARY FACTORS: (a) The extent of control which, by agreement, COMMISSION may exercise 
over the details of the work is slight rather than substantial; (b) CONSULTANT is engaged in a distinct 
occupation or business; (c) In the locality, the work to be done by CONSULTANT is usually done by a 
specialist without supervision, rather than under the direction of an employer; (d) The skill required in the 
particular occupation is substantial rather than slight; (e) The CONSULTANT rather than the COMMISSION 
supplies the instrumentalities, tools and work place; (f) The length of time for which CONSULTANT is 
engaged is of limited duration rather than indefinite; (g) The method of payment of CONSULTANT is by the 
job rather than by the time; (h) The work is part of a special or permissive activity, program, or project, rather 
than part of the regular business of COMMISSION; (i) CONSULTANT and COMMISSION believe they are 
creating an independent CONSULTANT relationship rather than an employer-employee relationship; and (j) 
The COMMISSION conducts public business. 
 
It is recognized that it is not necessary that all secondary factors support creation of an independent 
CONSULTANT relationship, but rather that overall there are significant secondary factors which indicate 
that CONSULTANT is an independent CONSULTANT. 
 
By their signatures to this Agreement, each of the undersigned certifies that it is his or her considered 
judgment that the CONSULTANT engaged under this Agreement is in fact an independent CONSULTANT. 
 
12. RETENTION AND AUDIT OF RECORDS. For the purpose of determining compliance with Public 
Contract Code 10115, et seq. and Title 21, California Code of Regulations, Chapter 21, Section 2500 et seq., 
if applicable and other matters connected with the performance of the contract pursuant to Government Code 
8546.7: CONSULTANT, subconsultants, and the COMMISSION shall maintain all books, documents, 
papers, accounting records, and other evidence pertaining to the performance of the contract, including but

Page 7 
not limited to, the costs of administering the Agreement. All parties shall make such materials available at 
their respective offices at all reasonable times during the Agreement period and for five (5) years from the 
date of final payment under this Agreement or until a final audit report is accepted by COMMISSION, 
whichever occurs first. The COMMISSION and any state or federal auditor, or any duly authorized 
representative of the state or federal government shall have access to any books, records, and documents of 
the CONSULTANT that are pertinent to the Agreement for audit, examinations, excerpts, and transactions, 
and copies thereof shall be furnished if requested. 
 
Subcontracts in excess of $25,000 shall contain this provision.
key_obligations: Consultant must maintain post-agreement tail coverage for 3 years if coverage is claims-made.
Consultant may obtain tail coverage via renewal or prior acts tail; cost deemed reasonable if not exceeding 100% of last annual premium.
Commission not responsible for premiums/assessments.
All required policies must name Santa Cruz County Regional Transportation Commission and related parties as additional insured.
Policies must not be canceled without 30 days' prior written notice to Commission.
Consultant must provide Certificates of Insurance and share the provisions with its broker before/at effective date.
red_flags: Reliance on reasonableness of cost for tail coverage could create ambiguity if insurance markets change.
56-word truncation in text hints at drafting issues (incomplete sentence/conforming language).
Not explicit on minimum coverage limits, endorsements beyond named insured/common conditions.
clauses.reasoning: The clause discusses requirements around insurance coverage, including form (claims-made vs occurrence), post-agreement tail coverage, additional insured status, cancellation notice, and certificates, which aligns with insurance-related terms.

clauses.title: INSPECTION OF WORK
clauses.text:
13. INSPECTION OF WORK 
 The CONSULTANT and any subconsultant shall permit the COMMISSION, the state, and the FHWA if 
federal participating funds are used in this contract, to review and inspect the project activities and files at all 
reasonable times during the term of this Agreement including review and inspection on a daily basis. 
 
14. ACKNOWLEDGMENT. CONSULTANT shall acknowledge in all reports and literature that the material is 
prepared for and on behalf of the COMMISSION. 
 
15. WORK PRODUCTS. All material, data, information, and written, graphic or other work produced under 
this Agreement is subject to the unqualified and unconditional right of the COMMISSION to use, reproduce, 
publish, display, and make derivative use of all such work, or any part of it, free of charge and in any manner 
and for any purpose; and to authorize others to do so. If any of the work is subject to copyright, trademark, 
service mark, or patent, CONSULTANT now grants to the COMMISSION a perpetual, royalty-free, 
nonexclusive and irrevocable license to use, reproduce, publish, use in the creation of derivative works, and 
display and perform the work, or any part of it, and to grant to any third party a comparable and coextensive 
sublicense. 
 
CONSULTANT shall include in any subcontract with a third party for work under this Agreement terms that 
preserve the rights, interests, and obligations created by this Section, and that identify the COMMISSION as 
a third-party beneficiary of those provisions. 
 
The CONSULTANT shall not utilize the work produced under this Agreement for any profit-making venture, 
or sell or grant rights to a third party for that purpose.
key_obligations: Consultant and subconsultants must permit review and inspection of project activities and files at reasonable times during the term (including daily review).
Consultant must ensure subcontract terms preserve Commission rights and designate Commission as a third-party beneficiary.
red_flags: Unqualified, unconditional right of the Commission to use, reproduce, publish, display, and derive use of all work without charge
Perpetual, royalty-free, nonexclusive, irrevocable license to Commission for all work (and sublicenses to third parties)
No profitability for Consultant from the work products; restriction on profit-making use by Consultant
Potential overbroad license scope and perpetual rights may impact Consultant’s future reuse.
clauses.reasoning: The section titled 'INSPECTION OF WORK' grants broad review and inspection rights by the COMMISSION, state, and FHWA, which aligns with audit/inspection provisions. However, the clause also contains substantial IP license terms (Work Products) and collaboration language, so it overlaps with intellectual_property and assignment-like provisions. The primary actionable portion is inspection/audit rights.

clauses.title: Upon completion of all work under this contract, ownership and title to all custom letters, reports,
clauses.text:
A. Upon completion of all work under this contract, ownership and title to all custom letters, reports, 
documents, plans, specifications, and estimates and other products produced as part of this Agreement 
(herein "deliverables") will automatically be vested in the COMMISSION; and no further agreement will 
be necessary to transfer ownership to the COMMISSION. The CONSULTANT shall furnish the 
COMMISSION all necessary copies of data needed to complete the review and approval process. Copies 
may be made for CONSULTANT's records but shall not be furnished to others without the 
COMMISSION's prior written authorization. Such deliverables shall be deemed works made for hire and 
all rights in copyright therein shall be retained by COMMISSION. All information derived from these 
deliverables is deemed confidential and may not be disclosed to any other party without the express prior 
written consent of COMMISSION. No information obtained during audit work performed under this 
Agreement may be used by CONSULTANT for any purpose (internal or external), nor may the 
information be discussed with others without the prior written consent of COMMISSION.
key_obligations: Deliverables automatically vest ownership and title in COMMISSION upon completion.
Consultant to furnish all necessary copies of data for Commission review.
Copies may be kept by Consultant for records but not shared without Commission consent.
Deliverables deemed works made for hire; Commission retains all copyright rights.
All information derived from deliverables deemed confidential and not to be disclosed without Commission consent.
Consultant may not use audit information for any purpose without Commission consent.
red_flags: Ownership and copyright owned by Commission with no consideration or reciprocity for consultant.
Works made for hire designation could limit Consultant's future use of deliverables.
Strong confidentiality with broad restrictions; potential overbreadth and lack of exceptions for legal disclosures.
No explicit carve-out for compliance with laws or for small-scale reuse unless authorized.
clauses.reasoning: The clause addresses ownership, works made for hire, and copyright in deliverables, which relates to IP rights.

clauses.title: Any subcontract in excess of $25,000 entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all of the
clauses.text:
B. Any subcontract in excess of $25,000 entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all of the 
provisions of this Section.

Page 8
key_obligations: Any subcontracting above $25,000 must incorporate all provisions of this Section.
red_flags: Ambiguity about which 'provisions' are included (depends on 'this Section' content not provided).
No detail on potential carve-outs or override mechanisms.
clauses.reasoning: The clause mandates that subcontracts above a monetary threshold include all provisions of 'this Section,' indicating a governance over how subcontracts must align with the main contract terms. It relates to the contractual work and deliverables flow, but primarily governs subcontracting terms rather than a standalone scope description.

clauses.title: SAFETY
clauses.text: 16. SAFETY
clauses.reasoning: The provided text only shows a title 'SAFETY' with no substantive language. It does not reveal indemnification, liability, or any standard category. Defaults to 'other' with a medium risk due to lack of content.

clauses.title: The CONSULTANT shall comply with OSHA regulations applicable to CONSULTANT regarding
clauses.text:
A. The CONSULTANT shall comply with OSHA regulations applicable to CONSULTANT regarding 
necessary safety equipment or procedures. The CONSULTANT shall comply with safety instructions 
issued by the COMMISSION Safety Officer and other COMMISSION representatives. CONSULTANT 
personnel shall wear hard hats and safety vests at all times while working on the Santa Cruz Branch Rail 
Line.
key_obligations: CONSULTANT shall comply with OSHA regulations applicable to CONSULTANT
CONSULTANT shall follow safety instructions issued by the COMMISSION Safety Officer and COMMISSION representatives
CONSULTANT personnel shall wear hard hats and safety vests at all times while working on the Santa Cruz Branch Rail Line
red_flags: No explicit consequences for non-compliance
Vague on enforcement, remedies, or audit rights
clauses.reasoning: The clause requires adherence to OSHA regulations and safety directives, which fits under a broad compliance category. It does not map neatly to a listed category but aligns with regulatory/compliance obligations.

clauses.title: Areas within the limits of the project are open to public and private traffic. The CONSULTANT shall
clauses.text:
B. Areas within the limits of the project are open to public and private traffic. The CONSULTANT shall 
comply with all of the requirements set forth in Divisions 11, 12, 13, 14, and 15 of the Vehicle Code. The 
CONSULTANT shall take all reasonably necessary precautions for safe operation of its vehicles and the 
protection of the traveling public from injury and damage from such vehicles.
key_obligations: Consultant shall comply with all requirements in Divisions 11-15 of the Vehicle Code.
Consultant shall take reasonably necessary precautions for safe operation of its vehicles and protection of the traveling public from injury and damage.
red_flags: Not explicit about remedies for non-compliance
Ambiguity in scope of 'reasonably necessary precautions' and potential enforcement remedies
clauses.reasoning: The clause requires compliance with specific vehicle code divisions and outlines safety precautions for vehicle operation, which aligns with regulatory compliance and safety obligations rather than the standard categories listed.

clauses.title: Any subcontract entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all of the provisions of this Section
clauses.text: C. Any subcontract entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all of the provisions of this Section.
key_obligations: Subcontracts must include all provisions of this Section.
red_flags: Ambiguity about which provisions are being included
No specific protections or carve-outs identified
Potential for general flow-down obligations without clarity
clauses.reasoning: The clause requires subcontracts to include all provisions of 'this Section', which commonly aims to extend terms (often related to liability, indemnification, or compliance) to subcontracts. However the specific provisions are not stated, so the exact category is unclear; closest standard label is indemnification/flow-down provisions, but it could be general flow-down or compliance. Since no explicit indemnity language is present, classification is uncertain.

clauses.title: MODIFICATION OF AGREEMENT
clauses.text: 17. MODIFICATION OF AGREEMENT.
clauses.reasoning: The title indicates modification of the agreement, which corresponds to amendment. However, the clause text itself is truncated ('# Limit to avoid token overflow'), providing no substantive language to assess. Classification is based on the heading, but without text, risk and obligations cannot be fully determined.

clauses.title: This Agreement may be amended or modified only by mutual written agreement of the parties
clauses.text: A. This Agreement may be amended or modified only by mutual written agreement of the parties.
key_obligations: Parties must consent in writing to any amendments or modifications.
clauses.reasoning: The clause explicitly states that the agreement may be amended or modified only by mutual written agreement, which fits the amendment category.

clauses.title: The CONSULTANT shall only commence work covered by an amendment after the amendment is
clauses.text:
B. The CONSULTANT shall only commence work covered by an amendment after the amendment is 
executed and notification to proceed has been provided by the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager.
key_obligations: Consultant may commence work only after amendment is executed.
Notification to proceed must be provided by the Contract Manager.
clauses.reasoning: The clause references commencement of work after an amendment is executed and notice provided, which relates to timing/renewal of the agreement rather than a standard substantive term like termination or scope. It also involves procedural requirement tied to amendments.

clauses.title: There shall be no change in the CONSULTANT’s Project Manager or members of the project team, as
clauses.text:
C. There shall be no change in the CONSULTANT’s Project Manager or members of the project team, as 
listed in the approved Fee Schedule, which is a part of this Agreement without prior written approval by 
the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager.
key_obligations: CONSULTANT shall not change the Project Manager or project team members listed in the approved Fee Schedule without prior written approval by the COMMISSION’s Contract Manager.
red_flags: No explicit remedy if approval is withheld or unreasonably denied
Possible rigidity over staffing without objective criteria
Lacks defined process or timeline for approval
clauses.reasoning: The clause restricts changes to personnel and requires prior written approval, reflecting a modification/approval requirement to change team members.

clauses.title: No oral understanding or agreement not incorporated herein shall be binding on the parties
clauses.text:
D. No oral understanding or agreement not incorporated herein shall be binding on the parties. 
 
18. DISPUTES. This Agreement shall be construed under the laws of the State of California. Pending final 
resolution of a dispute hereunder, CONSULTANT shall proceed diligently with the performance of this 
Agreement and shall comply with COMMISSION’s instructions.
key_obligations: No oral understandings outside written agreement are binding.
clauses.reasoning: Text states that no oral understanding or agreement not incorporated herein shall be binding, which is a classic integration/entire agreement clause. Also includes a disputes sub-clause about governing law and performance pending resolution.

clauses.title: Any dispute, other than audit, concerning a question of fact arising under this Agreement that is not
clauses.text:
A. Any dispute, other than audit, concerning a question of fact arising under this Agreement that is not 
disposed of by agreement shall be decided by a committee consisting of the COMMISSION’s Contract 
Manager and Executive Director, who shall consider written or verbal information submitted by the 
CONSULTANT.
key_obligations: Committee decision will resolve disputes on questions of fact not settled by agreement.
Consultant may submit information (written or verbal) to the committee for consideration.
red_flags: Clause references an informal committee process without specifying appeal rights, timelines, or binding nature beyond the committee decision
Excludes audit disputes explicitly; unclear if decisions are binding or reviewable
clauses.reasoning: The clause establishes a process for resolving disputes related to questions of fact, via a committee comprising specified parties, i.e., a dispute resolution mechanism.

clauses.title: Not later than 30 days after completion of all deliverables necessary to complete the plans, specifications
clauses.text:
B. Not later than 30 days after completion of all deliverables necessary to complete the plans, specifications 
and estimate, the CONSULTANT may request review by the COMMISSION GOVERNING BOARD of 
unresolved claims or disputes, other than audit. The request for review must be submitted in writing.
key_obligations: CONSULTANT must complete deliverables within the timeline
CONSULTANT may request review in writing within 30 days after completion
COMMISSION GOVERNING BOARD conducts review of unresolved claims or disputes (excluding audit)
red_flags: Limitation to unresolved claims 'other than audit' may narrow review scope
No detail on outcome, standards, or binding effect of the board's review
Ambiguity about who initiates, timelines for the board, and potential follow-up steps
clauses.reasoning: The clause describes a procedure to request review by a governing board for unresolved claims or disputes, which aligns with dispute resolution mechanisms. It does not fit other categories clearly and sets a specific process rather than general governing law or litigation terms.

clauses.title: Neither the pendency of a dispute, nor its consideration by the committee will excuse the CONSULTANT
clauses.text:
C. Neither the pendency of a dispute, nor its consideration by the committee will excuse the CONSULTANT 
from full and timely performance in accordance with the terms of this contract.
key_obligations: Consultant must continue full and timely performance under the contract regardless of dispute status or committee review.
red_flags: Ambiguity about how 'timely performance' is measured
No exceptions or relief provisions during disputes
Potentially conflicts with dispute resolution procedures or force majeure concepts
clauses.reasoning: The clause concerns performance obligations during a dispute, but does not clearly fit standard categories like termination, dispute_resolution, or force_majeure. It more closely resembles a general performance obligation during dispute, hence 'term' as a generic classification.

clauses.title: AUDIT REVIEW PROCEDURES
clauses.text: 19. AUDIT REVIEW PROCEDURES
clauses.reasoning: The title mentions audit review procedures, indicating a provision related to audit rights or access to records. The body text is missing, so classification defaults to the closest applicable category based on the title.

clauses.title: Any dispute concerning a question of fact arising under an interim or post-completion audit of this
clauses.text:
A. Any dispute concerning a question of fact arising under an interim or post-completion audit of this 
Agreement that is not disposed of by agreement, shall be reviewed by the COMMISSION’S Contract 
Manager.
key_obligations: Parties shall refer disputes concerning questions of fact arising under an interim or post-completion audit to the Commission’s Contract Manager for review if not resolved by agreement.
red_flags: No explicit mechanism (arbitration, mediation, or court) specified for final resolution
Unclear scope and authority of the Contract Manager
Potential ambiguity on who bears costs of review
clauses.reasoning: The clause addresses how disputes related to factual questions in audits are to be reviewed, indicating a process for dispute handling rather than a general litigation/arbitration framework.

clauses.title: Not later than 30 days after issuance of the final audit report, the CONSULTANT may request a review
clauses.text:
B. Not later than 30 days after issuance of the final audit report, the CONSULTANT may request a review 
by the COMMISSION’S Executive Director of unresolved audit issues. The request for review will be 
submitted in writing.
key_obligations: Not later than 30 days after issuance of the final audit report, CONSULTANT may request a review
REQUEST for review must be submitted in writing
Review will be conducted by the COMMISSION’S Executive Director
red_flags: Ambiguity on binding outcome of the review
No explicit timeline for the Executive Director's decision
Unclear whether the review is mandatory or consultative
clauses.reasoning: The clause outlines a procedural step for review of unresolved audit issues, implying a recourse beyond initial findings, which aligns with dispute resolution procedures. It is not clearly arbitration/mediation/litigation but serves as an internal review mechanism.

clauses.title: Neither the pendency of a dispute nor its consideration by the COMMISSION will excuse the
clauses.text:
C. Neither the pendency of a dispute nor its consideration by the COMMISSION will excuse the 
CONSULTANT from full and timely performance, in accordance with the terms of this contract.
key_obligations: Consultant must perform fully and timely despite dispute or its consideration by the Commission
red_flags: No relief during disputes (no excuse for non-performance) could create performance risk if disputes cause delays
Ambiguity on what constitutes 'timely performance' and potential remedies for delays
clauses.reasoning: The clause relates to timing of performance and ongoing obligations despite disputes, which is a timing/term-related provision rather than a standard category like termination or force_majeure.

clauses.title: SUBCONTRACTING
clauses.text: 20. SUBCONTRACTING
red_flags: No substantive text provided; unable to determine actual obligations or restrictions
Ambiguity about permissibility, approval process, and flow-down terms
clauses.reasoning: The title 'SUBCONTRACTING' and placeholder text suggest the clause would govern whether subcontracting is permitted and under what conditions, which relates to the scope and execution of services rather than a specific risk or obligation.

clauses.title: The CONSULTANT shall perform the work contemplated with resources available within its own
clauses.text:
A. The CONSULTANT shall perform the work contemplated with resources available within its own 
organization; and no portion of the work pertinent to this Agreement shall be subcontracted without prior 
written authorization by the COMMISSION’S Contract Manager, except that, which is expressly 
identified in the approved Fee Schedule.

Page 9
key_obligations: Consultant shall perform the work with resources within its own organization
Subcontracting prohibited without prior written authorization by the Commission’s Contract Manager
Subcontracting is allowed only for items expressly identified in the approved Fee Schedule
red_flags: No express consequences for non-compliance or failure to obtain authorization
Authority to approve subcontracting is centralized to Contract Manager; potential for delays
clauses.reasoning: The clause describes how the CONSULTANT will perform the work, using its own resources and limiting subcontracting, which relates to the scope and method of performing services.

clauses.title: Any subcontract in excess of $25,000 entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all the
clauses.text:
B. Any subcontract in excess of $25,000 entered into as a result of this contract, shall contain all the 
provisions required by this Agreement to be applicable to those subconsultants.
key_obligations: Any subcontract over $25,000 must include all provisions required by this Agreement applicable to subconsultants.
red_flags: Vague about which provisions apply
No specificity on carve-outs, approval process, or enforcement mechanisms
clauses.reasoning: Not a standard category exactly; it concerns subcontracting and ensuring subcontracts include provisions from the main agreement. Closest fit is 'scope_of_work' or 'assignment'/'amendment' breadth, but it does not fit neatly into a standard category.

clauses.title: No substitution of subconsultants shall be valid until approved in writing by the COMMISSION’s
clauses.text:
C. No substitution of subconsultants shall be valid until approved in writing by the COMMISSION’s 
Contract Manager. 
 
21. NONASSIGNMENT. The CONSULTANT shall not assign the Agreement without the prior written consent 
of the COMMISSION. 
 
22. REBATES, KICKBACKS OR OTHER UNLAWFUL CONSIDERATION. The CONSULTANT 
warrants that this Agreement was not obtained or secured through rebates kickbacks or other unlawful 
consideration, either promised or paid to any COMMISSION employee. For breach or violation of this 
warranty, COMMISSION shall have the right in its discretion to terminate the Agreement without liability; to 
pay only for the value of the work actually performed; or to deduct from the contract price; or otherwise 
recover the full amount of such rebate, kickback or other unlawful consideration. 
 
23. NOTIFICATION. All notices hereunder and communications regarding interpretation of the terms of this 
Agreement and changes thereto, shall be effected by the mailing thereof by registered or certified mail, return 
receipt requested, postage prepaid, and addressed as follows: 
 
CONSULTANT: 
 
 
__________(CONSULTANT)_______________ 
 
 
__________(NAME)________, Project Manager 
 
 
__________(ADDRESS)____________________ 
 
 
 
 
COMMISSION: 
 
 
Santa Cruz County Regional Transportation Commission (SCCRTC) 
 
 
Luis Mendez, Contract Manager 
 
 
1523 Pacific Ave, Santa Cruz, CA 95060
key_obligations: Consultant shall not assign the Agreement without prior written consent of the COMMISSION.
red_flags: No explicit mechanism or standards for consent (subjective discretion of COMMISSION).
Potential rigidity may affect assignment flexibility for Consultant.
clauses.reasoning: The excerpt includes a subsections labeled 'NONASSIGNMENT' prohibiting assignment without consent, and a separate clause about substitution of subconsultants. The dominant binding element is the restriction on assignment of the agreement, which fits 'assignment'. Some elements touch on subcontracting (subconsultants) but the primary risk-related term is the nonassignment clause.

clauses.title: COMPLETE AGREEMENT
clauses.text: 24. COMPLETE AGREEMENT
clauses.reasoning: The title 'COMPLETE AGREEMENT' and the clause label suggest an integration clause stating that the written agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties. No substantive text is provided beyond the title.

clauses.title: AGREEMENT: The two parties to this Agreement, who are the before named CONSULTANT and the
clauses.text:
A. AGREEMENT: The two parties to this Agreement, who are the before named CONSULTANT and the 
before named COMMISSION, hereby agree that this Agreement constitutes the entire Agreement which 
is made and concluded in duplicate between the two parties. Both of these parties for and in consideration 
of the payments to made, conditions mentioned, and work to be performed; each agree to diligently 
perform in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement as evidenced by the signatures 
below.
key_obligations: Both parties acknowledge this document as the entire agreement between CONSULTANT and COMMISSION.
Parties pledge to diligently perform in accordance with the terms and conditions.
clauses.reasoning: The clause explicitly states that the agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties and that signatures evidence performance; this matches the 'entire_agreement' category (integration clause).

clauses.title: COMMISSION DESIGNEE: The Executive Director of COMMISSION, or his or her designee, shall
clauses.text:
B. COMMISSION DESIGNEE: The Executive Director of COMMISSION, or his or her designee, shall 
have the authority to act for and exercise any of the rights of COMMISSION as set forth in this 
Agreement subsequent to, and in accordance with the authorization granted by the COMMISSION.
key_obligations: Designee is empowered to exercise rights of COMMISSION under the Agreement
Actions must be in accordance with authorization granted by the COMMISSION
red_flags: Potential for broader exercise of rights beyond initial scope if not tightly defined
Designee’s authority depends on existing authorization; need explicit scope and limits
clauses.reasoning: The clause grants authority to a designee to act on behalf of the commission under the agreement. It aligns with related concepts of representation/agency rather than a standard predefined category. If strictly limited to standard categories, closest match is 'assignment' or 'amendment' none fit perfectly; thus 'other' with a similar authorization/agent concept. However, I labeled as 'authorization' to reflect the core idea of delegating rights. Please advise if you want it classified under 'power_of_attorney' or 'assignment' in your taxonomy.

clauses.title: COMPLETE AGREEMENT, INCLUDING ATTACHMENTS. This Agreement includes all exhibits,
clauses.text:
C. COMPLETE AGREEMENT, INCLUDING ATTACHMENTS. This Agreement includes all exhibits, 
attachments, and documents incorporated herein and made applicable by reference, constitutes the 
complete and exclusive statement of the terms and conditions of the Agreement between COMMISSION 
and CONSULTANT, and supersedes all prior representations, understandings and communications. The 
invalidity in whole or in part of any term or condition of this Agreement shall not affect the validity of 
other terms or conditions. The COMMISSION’s waiver of CONSULTANT's performance of any term(s) 
or condition(s) of this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver for any future performance of such 
term(s) or conditions(s
key_obligations: This Agreement constitutes the complete and exclusive statement of terms.
Exhibits, attachments, and documents incorporated by reference are part of the agreement.
red_flags: No explicit carve-outs for fraud, misrepresentation, or gross negligence
No severability caveat beyond implying invalid terms do not affect others (though it mentions partial invalidity)
clauses.reasoning: The clause states that the agreement and its attachments constitute the complete and exclusive statement of terms and supersedes prior communications, which is the hallmark of an integration/entire agreement clause.

clauses.title: Attachments are:
clauses.text:
D. Attachments are: 
 
Exhibit A: Scope of Services

Page 10 
 
Exhibit B: Fee Schedule 
 
Each of the undersigned represents and warrants that he or she is duly authorized to execute and deliver this 
Agreement and that such execution is binding upon the entity for which he or she is executing this document. 
 
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement No. _______ to be executed on the date 
first written above.
key_obligations: Signatories represent and warrant they are duly authorized to execute and bind the entity.
clauses.reasoning: The clause includes a representation/warranty that signatories are duly authorized to execute and bind the entity, which aligns with warranties or representations. It also references attachments/exhibits but primarily contains authorization representations.

clauses.title: CONSULTANT
clauses.text: 1. CONSULTANT
clauses.reasoning: The provided text is only a title and a brief note ('CONSULTANT') with no substantive language. It does not express a standard contractual clause or obligations.
